Have you tried wireshark for sniffing?
I just used to to solve a failing Soap system.....
Silly MS shop tried to setup a SOAP server....
I use it on terminals...  tshark has earned me $$$$
It can be run as a common user and do a very good job....
In other words....  Troubleshoot....  then turn it off....
There are a couple of methods....  The first one is to just dump everything...  And look for port 8000...  then follow the TCP stream  (Right click)
The other way is to just set the filter at the top......  The filtering system is very point/click....  Look for port and insert 8000
That took a few minutes...  I chalk it up to complex packet scanners....
Just right click on one of the packets and select "Follow TCP Stream".....
Takes me about 10 minutes to demonstrate surfing without SSL to clients with Wireshark....
